intro: Dianthus hirtus, commonly known as the hairy pinks, is a flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region. It is characterized by its pink to red flowers that bloom in early spring. The plant typically grows to a height of 10–30 cm and has hairy stems and leaves. Its flowers are borne in clusters and have five petals, with a distinctive frilled edge. Dianthus hirtus is often cultivated in gardens for its ornamental value and ability to thrive in well-drained soils.
